column1: Once upon a time in a mountainous African village there lived a famous blacksmith. The villagers called him Ratshipi - the man of iron and steel. Ratshipi was known by everyone in the village. Villagers went to his shop every morning to watch him work. He seemed to be able to make anything with his iron and steel. Kgosi Mogale
column3: heard about Ratshipi's work. He sent his servants to bring Ratshipi to the palace. Ratshipi was happy to hear that Kgosi Mogale wanted to see him. "I will be very happy to work for the chief
column4: he said. So Ratshipi went to the palace. Ratshipi
column5: I have heard about your good work
column6: said Kgosi Mogale. I want you to do a very special task." "With your iron and steel
column7: I want you to build a man who can walk
column8: cry real tears and bleed real human blood." "Impossible!" thought Ratshipi. But no one could say no to the king in this village. Ratshipi could not sleep that night. How was he going to do this impossible task? He was very scared and very worried. Suddenly
column9: Ratshipi remembered a wise old man Rapule. Perhaps he could help.
